title: Following the Disputation of Paris, twenty-four carriage loads of Jewish religious manuscripts were burnt in Paris.
text: Following the Disputation of Paris, twenty-four carriage loads of Jewish religious manuscripts were burnt in Paris.

title: The Kalmar Union is formed under the rule of Margaret I of Denmark.
text: The Kalmar Union is formed under the rule of Margaret I of Denmark.

title: Vlad III the Impaler attempts to assassinate Mehmed II (The Night Attack at Târgovişte), forcing him to retreat from Wallachia.
text: Vlad III the Impaler attempts to assassinate Mehmed II (The Night Attack at Târgovişte), forcing him to retreat from Wallachia.

title: Battle of Deptford Bridge: Forces under King Henry VII defeat troops led by Michael An Gof.
text: Battle of Deptford Bridge: Forces under King Henry VII defeat troops led by Michael An Gof.

title: Matsunaga Hisahide assassinates the 13th Ashikaga shogun, Ashikaga Yoshiteru.
text: Matsunaga Hisahide assassinates the 13th Ashikaga shogun, Ashikaga Yoshiteru.

title: Sir Francis Drake claims a land he calls Nova Albion (modern California) for England.
text: Sir Francis Drake claims a land he calls Nova Albion (modern California) for England.

title: The Dutch explorer Willem Barentsz discovers the Arctic archipelago of Spitsbergen.
text: The Dutch explorer Willem Barentsz discovers the Arctic archipelago of Spitsbergen.

title: Mumtaz Mahal dies during childbirth. Her husband, Mughal emperor Shah Jahan I, will spend the next 17 years building her mausoleum, the Taj Mahal.
text: Mumtaz Mahal dies during childbirth. Her husband, Mughal emperor Shah Jahan I, will spend the next 17 years building her mausoleum, the Taj Mahal.

title: French explorers Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet reach the Mississippi River and become the first Europeans to make a detailed account of its course.
text: French explorers Jacques Marquette and Louis Jolliet reach the Mississippi River and become the first Europeans to make a detailed account of its course.

title: Samuel Wallis, an English sea captain, sights Tahiti and is considered the first European to reach the island.
text: Samuel Wallis, an English sea captain, sights Tahiti and is considered the first European to reach the island.

title: Cúcuta, Colombia, is founded by Juana Rangel de Cuéllar.
text: Cúcuta, Colombia, is founded by Juana Rangel de Cuéllar.

title: American Revolutionary War: Colonists inflict heavy casualties on British forces while losing the Battle of Bunker Hill.
text: American Revolutionary War: Colonists inflict heavy casualties on British forces while losing the Battle of Bunker Hill.

title: In France, the Third Estate declares itself the National Assembly.
text: In France, the Third Estate declares itself the National Assembly.

title: Foundation of Anglo-Corsican Kingdom.
text: Foundation of Anglo-Corsican Kingdom.

title: The burghers of Swellendam expel the Dutch East India Company magistrate and declare a republic.
text: The burghers of Swellendam expel the Dutch East India Company magistrate and declare a republic.

title: In the Kingdom of Hawaii, Kamehameha III issues the edict of toleration which gives Roman Catholics the freedom to worship in the Hawaiian Islands. The Hawaii Catholic Church and the Cathedral of Our Lady of Peace are established as a result.
text: In the Kingdom of Hawaii, Kamehameha III issues the edict of toleration which gives Roman Catholics the freedom to worship in the Hawaiian Islands. The Hawaii Catholic Church and the Cathedral of Our Lady of Peace are established as a result.

title: The Wairau Affray, the first serious clash of arms between Māori and British settlers in the New Zealand Wars, takes place.
text: The Wairau Affray, the first serious clash of arms between Māori and British settlers in the New Zealand Wars, takes place.

title: American Civil War: Battle of Vienna, Virginia.
text: American Civil War: Battle of Vienna, Virginia.

title: American Civil War: Battle of Aldie in the Gettysburg Campaign.
text: American Civil War: Battle of Aldie in the Gettysburg Campaign.

title: American Indian Wars: Battle of the Rosebud: One thousand five hundred Sioux and Cheyenne led by Crazy Horse beat back General George Crook's forces at Rosebud Creek in Montana Territory.
text: American Indian Wars: Battle of the Rosebud: One thousand five hundred Sioux and Cheyenne led by Crazy Horse beat back General George Crook's forces at Rosebud Creek in Montana Territory.

title: American Indian Wars: Battle of White Bird Canyon: The Nez Perce defeat the U.S. Cavalry at White Bird Canyon in the Idaho Territory.
text: American Indian Wars: Battle of White Bird Canyon: The Nez Perce defeat the U.S. Cavalry at White Bird Canyon in the Idaho Territory.

title: The Statue of Liberty arrives in New York Harbor.
text: The Statue of Liberty arrives in New York Harbor.

title: The United States Navy Hospital Corps is established.
text: The United States Navy Hospital Corps is established.

title: Boxer Rebellion: Western Allied and Japanese forces capture the Taku Forts in Tianjin, China.
text: Boxer Rebellion: Western Allied and Japanese forces capture the Taku Forts in Tianjin, China.

title: The College Board introduces its first standardized test, the forerunner to the SAT.
text: The College Board introduces its first standardized test, the forerunner to the SAT.

title: Aurel Vlaicu pilots an A. Vlaicu nr. 1 on its first flight.
text: Aurel Vlaicu pilots an A. Vlaicu nr. 1 on its first flight.

title: Portuguese naval aviators Gago Coutinho and Sacadura Cabral complete the first aerial crossing of the South Atlantic.
text: Portuguese naval aviators Gago Coutinho and Sacadura Cabral complete the first aerial crossing of the South Atlantic.

title: The town of Murchison, New Zealand Is rocked by a 7.8 magnitude earthquake killing 17. At the time it was New Zealand's worst natural disaster.
text: The town of Murchison, New Zealand Is rocked by a 7.8 magnitude earthquake killing 17. At the time it was New Zealand's worst natural disaster.

title: U.S. President Herbert Hoover signs the Smoot–Hawley Tariff Act into law.
text: U.S. President Herbert Hoover signs the Smoot–Hawley Tariff Act into law.

title: Bonus Army: Around a thousand World War I veterans amass at the United States Capitol as the U.S. Senate considers a bill that would give them certain benefits.
text: Bonus Army: Around a thousand World War I veterans amass at the United States Capitol as the U.S. Senate considers a bill that would give them certain benefits.

title: Union Station massacre: In Kansas City, Missouri, four FBI agents and captured fugitive Frank Nash are gunned down by gangsters attempting to free Nash.
text: Union Station massacre: In Kansas City, Missouri, four FBI agents and captured fugitive Frank Nash are gunned down by gangsters attempting to free Nash.

title: Last public guillotining in France: Eugen Weidmann, a convicted murderer, is guillotined in Versailles outside the Saint-Pierre prison.
text: Last public guillotining in France: Eugen Weidmann, a convicted murderer, is guillotined in Versailles outside the Saint-Pierre prison.

title: World War II: RMS Lancastria is attacked and sunk by the Luftwaffe near Saint-Nazaire, France. At least 3,000 are killed in Britain's worst maritime disaster.
text: World War II: RMS Lancastria is attacked and sunk by the Luftwaffe near Saint-Nazaire, France. At least 3,000 are killed in Britain's worst maritime disaster.

title: World War II: The British Army's 11th Hussars assault and take Fort Capuzzo in Libya, Africa from Italian forces.
text: World War II: The British Army's 11th Hussars assault and take Fort Capuzzo in Libya, Africa from Italian forces.

title: The three Baltic states of Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania fall under the occupation of the Soviet Union.
text: The three Baltic states of Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania fall under the occupation of the Soviet Union.

title: Iceland declares independence from Denmark and becomes a republic.
text: Iceland declares independence from Denmark and becomes a republic.

title: A Douglas DC-6 carrying United Airlines Flight 624 crashes near Mount Carmel, Pennsylvania, killing all 43 people on board.
text: A Douglas DC-6 carrying United Airlines Flight 624 crashes near Mount Carmel, Pennsylvania, killing all 43 people on board.

title: Cold War: East Germany Workers Uprising: In East Germany, the Soviet Union orders a division of troops into East Berlin to quell a rebellion.
text: Cold War: East Germany Workers Uprising: In East Germany, the Soviet Union orders a division of troops into East Berlin to quell a rebellion.

title: The Ironworkers Memorial Second Narrows Crossing, in the process of being built to connect Vancouver and North Vancouver (Canada), collapses into the Burrard Inlet killing many of the ironworkers and injuring others.
text: The Ironworkers Memorial Second Narrows Crossing, in the process of being built to connect Vancouver and North Vancouver (Canada), collapses into the Burrard Inlet killing many of the ironworkers and injuring others.

title: The Nez Perce tribe is awarded $4 million for 7 million acres (28,000 km2) of land undervalued at four cents/acre in the 1863 treaty.
text: The Nez Perce tribe is awarded $4 million for 7 million acres (28,000 km2) of land undervalued at four cents/acre in the 1863 treaty.

title: The United States Supreme Court rules 8–1 in Abington School District v. Schempp against requiring the reciting of Bible verses and the Lord's Prayer in public schools.
text: The United States Supreme Court rules 8–1 in Abington School District v. Schempp against requiring the reciting of Bible verses and the Lord's Prayer in public schools.

title: A day after South Vietnamese President Ngô Đình Diệm announced the Joint Communiqué to end the Buddhist crisis, a riot involving around 2,000 people breaks out. One person is killed.
text: A day after South Vietnamese President Ngô Đình Diệm announced the Joint Communiqué to end the Buddhist crisis, a riot involving around 2,000 people breaks out. One person is killed.

title: Nuclear weapons testing: The People's Republic of China announces a successful test of its first thermonuclear weapon.
text: Nuclear weapons testing: The People's Republic of China announces a successful test of its first thermonuclear weapon.

title: Watergate scandal: Five White House operatives are arrested for burgling the offices of the Democratic National Committee, in an attempt by some members of the Republican party to illegally wiretap the opposition.
text: Watergate scandal: Five White House operatives are arrested for burgling the offices of the Democratic National Committee, in an attempt by some members of the Republican party to illegally wiretap the opposition.

title: Space Shuttle program: STS-51-G mission: Space Shuttle Discovery launches carrying Sultan bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, the first Arab and first Muslim in space, as a payload specialist.
text: Space Shuttle program: STS-51-G mission: Space Shuttle Discovery launches carrying Sultan bin Salman bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, the first Arab and first Muslim in space, as a payload specialist.

title: With the death of the last individual of the species, the dusky seaside sparrow becomes extinct.
text: With the death of the last individual of the species, the dusky seaside sparrow becomes extinct.

title: Apartheid: The South African Parliament repeals the Population Registration Act which required racial classification of all South Africans at birth.
text: Apartheid: The South African Parliament repeals the Population Registration Act which required racial classification of all South Africans at birth.

title: A "joint understanding" agreement on arms reduction is signed by U.S. President George Bush and Russian President Boris Yeltsin (this would be later codified in START II).
text: A "joint understanding" agreement on arms reduction is signed by U.S. President George Bush and Russian President Boris Yeltsin (this would be later codified in START II).

title: Following a televised low-speed highway chase, O. J. Simpson is arrested for the murders of his ex-wife, Nicole Brown Simpson, and her friend Ronald Goldman.
text: Following a televised low-speed highway chase, O. J. Simpson is arrested for the murders of his ex-wife, Nicole Brown Simpson, and her friend Ronald Goldman.

title: Nine people are killed in a mass shooting at Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, South Carolina.

title: A series of wildfires in central Portugal kill at least 64 people and injure 204 others.
